text:
L ondon has come out on top at this year's Class Bar Awards, with The Dandelyan, located inside the Mondrian Hotel , winning four awards including Best Bar in the UK and Hotel Bar of the Year.
Created by Iain Griffiths and Ryan Chetiyawardana, The Dandelyan offers innovative drinks themed around the concept of 'Modern Botany'. The bar also won the Drinks Menu of the Year award, while head bartender Aidan Bowie was named Bartender of the Year.
The Dandelyan regularly appears in round ups of the best bars around the world and was recently named the third best bar in the world at the World's 50 Best Bar Awards.

C ovent Garden's Swift, which specialises in quick drinks, was named New Bar of the Year at the Class awards, with Bobby Hiddleston scooping up the award for Bar Manager of the Year for his work at Swift and the Lewis Carroll-themed Callooh Callay in Shoreditch.
Hawksmoor Spitalfields was named Restaurant Bar of the Year, besting The Blind Pig and Edinburgh's Bon Vivant to win the award.
Master distiller Jake Burger was given the Lifetime Achievement award for his work at bars The Distillery and Portobello Road, and a 20 year career in the drinks business.
Lifetime Achievement award winner Jake Burger T he Class awards recogonise talent, achievements and diversity across the UK bar industry and winners are selected by panel of 85 expert judges including former head bartender at the Savoy Hotel , Peter Dorelli, and cocktail specialists Jared Brown and Anistatia Miller.
